title: Flying skull

|   | An undead skull kept aloft and flitting swiftly about by unholy magic.***“Alas, poor Yorick! I knew him, Horatio, a fellow of infinite jest, of most excellent fancy. He hath bore me on his back a thousand times, and now how abhorr’d in my imagination it is! My gorge rises at it.” -William Shakespeare, \_The Tragedy of Hamlet, Prince of Denmark\_, V, 1. 1603. |

## Useful Info

**Flying skulls** are weak pack monsters, fast and prone to [noisy](/Noise "Noise") shrieking. They are found in [the Crypt](/The_Crypt "The Crypt"), [the Tomb](/The_Tomb "The Tomb"), the [Hells](/Hell "Hell"), [the Abyss](/The_Abyss "The Abyss"), and [Pandemonium](/Pandemonium "Pandemonium").

## Tips & Tricks

- Although mostly harmless, they attract enough attention to be a pest to [stealthy](/Stealth "Stealth") characters.
- If you know [Lee's Rapid Deconstruction](/Lee%27s_Rapid_Deconstruction "Lee's Rapid Deconstruction"), they make excellent sources of shrapnel. Of course, by using LRD, you'll be abandoning stealth entirely.

## History

- Flying skulls were removed and replaced with [laughing skulls](/Laughing_skull "Laughing skull") and [weeping skulls](/Weeping_skull "Weeping skull") in [0.31](/0.31 "0.31").
- Prior to [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), they were even weaker and punier.

Flying skull

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
flying skull z 
HP 13-28
HD 7
XP 228
Speed 15
AC 10
EV 17
Will 20
Attack1 14 (hit: plain)


Resistances rF+
rC+
rElec
rPois+++
rDrown
rMiasma
rN+++
rTorm
Vulnerabilities Holy
Habitat Land
Intelligence Animal
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Undead
Size Tiny
Type flying skull, flying skull
Flags Evil
Flying
Unbreathing
An undead skull kept aloft and flitting swiftly about by unholy magic.

“Alas, poor Yorick! I knew him, Horatio, a fellow of infinite jest, of most excellent fancy. He hath bore me on his back a thousand times, and now how abhorr’d in my imagination it is! My gorge rises at it.”
-William Shakespeare, _The Tragedy of Hamlet, Prince of Denmark_, V, 1. 1603.

Useful Info

Flying skulls are weak pack monsters, fast and prone to noisy shrieking. They are found in the Crypt, the Tomb, the Hells, the Abyss, and Pandemonium.

Tips & Tricks

  • Although mostly harmless, they attract enough attention to be a pest to stealthy characters.
  • If you know Lee's Rapid Deconstruction, they make excellent sources of shrapnel. Of course, by using LRD, you'll be abandoning stealth entirely.

History

  • Flying skulls were removed and replaced with laughing skulls and weeping skulls in 0.31.
  • Prior to 0.13, they were even weaker and punier.

rawPage:
{{obsolete}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Flying skulls''' are weak pack monsters, fast and prone to [[noise|noisy]] shrieking. They are found in [[the Crypt]], [[the Tomb]], the [[Hell]]s, [[the Abyss]], and [[Pandemonium]].

==Tips & Tricks==
*Although mostly harmless, they attract enough attention to be a pest to [[stealth]]y characters.
*If you know [[Lee's Rapid Deconstruction]], they make excellent sources of shrapnel. Of course, by using LRD, you'll be abandoning stealth entirely.

==History==
*Flying skulls were removed and replaced with [[laughing skull]]s and [[weeping skull]]s in [[0.31]].
*Prior to [[0.13]], they were even weaker and punier.
